##Priority Service

There is a priority service available for £23.40. If you order online by 4pm on a working day, your certificate is sent the next working day by first class post. If you want to use special delivery, contact the General Register Office by phone.

$C
**General Register Office**  
0300 123 1837
$C

##Post
You can [order certificates by post](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/publications/agencies-public-bodies/ips/general-ips-publications/certificate-application-forms/ "Order certificates by post"){:rel="external"} by completing a form.

##Register offices
You can also order certificates from the [local register office](/register-offices "local register office") where the birth, death or marriage was registered.

##Scotland and Northern Ireland
[Get a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate in Scotland](http://www.gro-scotland.gov.uk/contacts/opentime/index.html/ "Get a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate in Scotland"){:rel="external"}

[Get a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate in Northern Ireland](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/index/do-it-online/government-citizens-and-rights-online/order-a-birth-adoption-death-marriage-or-civil-partnership-certificate.htm "Get a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate in Northern Ireland"){:rel="external"}
introduction: You'll need to register on the General Register Office website to order a copy of a birth, adoption, death, marriage or civil partnership certificate. Certificates cost £9.25. You can use this service to help you research your family tree.
overview: Order an official birth, marriage or death certificate from the General Register Office (GRO) if you need a copy or want to research your family tree
title: Order a copy of a birth, death or marriage certificate
